intro: Trollius napellifolius modif. nitens, commonly known as the yellow archangel, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the genus Trollius in the family Asteraceae, characterized by its showy, daisy-like flowers. The plant typically features bright yellow petals surrounding a central disk, with finely divided, fern-like leaves. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in meadows and woodland edges. Its botanical structure supports its role as a nectar source for pollinators.
